author: bertram,m.h. and blackstock,t.a.
body: some simple solutions to the problem of predicting boundary layer self-induced pressures . simplified theoretical approaches are shown, based on hypersonic similarity boundary-layer theory, which allow reasonably accurate estimates to be made of the surface pressures on plates on which viscous effects are important .  the consideration of viscous effects includes the cases where curved surfaces, stream pressure gradients, and leading-edge bluntness are important factors .
title: some simple solutions to the problem of predicting boundary layer self-induced pressures .
